newsitem.title: UNITED NATIONS: PLO protests to U.N. over Jerusalem tunnel entrance.
newsitem.headline: PLO protests to U.N. over Jerusalem tunnel entrance.

text.p: The Palestine Liberation Organisation (PLO) called on the Security Council on Tuesday to reverse Israel's action in opening an entrance to a tunnel in the Old City of Jerusalem, saying it endangered the al-Aqsa Mosque and other Islamic structures.

In virtually identical letters to the president of the Security Council and Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali, PLO U.N. observer Nasser al-Kidwa said the tunnel was opened on Monday evening "under the protection of army units" and "extends for approximately 500 yards (metres), parallel to the Western Wall of al-Aqsa Mosque."
He said the "opening of this entrance and any use of the tunnel endanger the security and integrity of al-Aqsa Mosque and the foundations of the Islamic structures existing above the tunnel."
Al-Kidwa said Security Council resolutions had declared that all Israeli measures and actions aimed at changing the status of Jerusalem were invalid and called on Israel to rescind them.
"The above-mentioned Israeli action is obviously another measure aimed at the Judaization of the city, creating yet additional facts with regard to the Holy City's status."
He called on the Security Council to "take the necessary steps to address this issue and to have the Israeli action reversed."

Israel's Tourism Ministry said the tunnel, leading to archaeological sites near Jerusalem's Temple Mount, sacred to both Judaism and Islam, takes visitors on a journey through 2,500 years of history, including the time of Jesus. It would more than quadruple the number of tourists able to visit the site, the ministry added.
